title: Bag Face, mid–late 18th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: satin and chain stitch embroidery
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Cream white taffeta embroidered in "colonial" silks. At center, a woman is seated beside baskets of flowers. A boy displays a white bird. Two small children are at the side. Their faces are painted, and a floral vine encloses the scene.

tombstone.epitaph:
Bag Face, mid–late 18th century.
mid–late 18th century. Medium: silk
Technique: satin and chain stitch embroidery. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-52-13.
